tit.cmt: branch castleが定訳ではないようなので、念のためローマ字表記にしました。

sen.j: 支城（しじょう）とは、本城を守るように配置された補助的役割を持つ出城・砦・陣屋などのことを指す。
sen.e: A branch castle refers to an outer citadel, fort or fortification built to protect the main castle and perform a backup role.
A branch castle refers to an outer citadel, fort or fortification built to protect the main castle and perform a backup role.
Shijo refers to an outer citadel, fort or fortification built to protect the main castle and perform a backup role.

sen.j: 本城を指す根城に比して枝城などとも呼ばれた。
sen.e: It was called an 'edajira' or branch castle to distinguish it from the main castle or 'honjo'.
It was called an 'edajira' or branch castle to distinguish it from the main castle or 'honjo'.
It was called an 'edajiro' (branch castle) to distinguish it from 'nejiro' (root castle) which indicates the main castle.

sen.j: 役割によって様々な種類があり、規模も大小様々である。
sen.e: There are many types depending on the role and they also varied in scale.
There are many types depending on the role and they also varied in scale.
There are many types depending on the role and they also varied in scale.

sen.j: 戦国時代_(日本)には、本城・支城間に支城網（しじょうもう）と呼ばれる多彩なネットワークが形成されるようになった。
sen.e: In the Warring States period (Japan) a diverse network called a branch castle network was created between the main castle and branch castle.
In the Warring States period (Japan) a diverse network called a branch castle network was created between the main castle and branch castle.
In the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) (Japan) a diverse network called 'shijo-mo' was created between the main castle and shijo.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

defense outpost

sen.j: 詰の城 本城を守る防衛用の出城。
sen.e: An outer citadel used for defending the primary castle or main castle.
An outer citadel used for defending the primary castle or main castle.
An outer citadel: Used for defending the main castle.

sen.j: 本城に近く、尚且つ山など防衛に適した要害の地に作られることが多い
sen.e: Mostly built near the main castle and in strategic locations such as mountains suited to defense.
Mostly built near the main castle and in strategic locations such as mountains suited to defense.
Mostly built near the main castle and in strategic locations such as mountains suited to defense.

directly controlled branch castle

castle built for attacking enemy castle

sen.j: 向城・付城・対の城 城攻めの際に城に相対するように築城する城。
sen.e: A facing castle, confronting castle or annex castle, a castle built to attack the enemy castle
A facing castle, confronting castle or annex castle, a castle built to attack the enemy castle
A facing castle, confronting castle or annex castle: A castle built to attack the enemy castle

sen.j: 境の城・境目の城 領地の境にある城
sen.e: Border castles, boundary castles, castles on the perimeter of the grounds
Border castles, boundary castles, castles on the perimeter of the grounds
Border castles or boundary castles: Castles on the perimeter of the territory

sen.j: 番城・番手城 城主がおらず本城から直轄されている支城 (江戸時代の大阪城や二条城なども公儀の番城としてこれに当たる)
sen.e: Banjiro branch castle or guard castle, a branch castle without its own lord, directly controlled by the main castle (Osaka Castle and Nijo Castle in the Edo period are among such castles of the shogunate government.)

Banjiro branch castle or guard castle, a branch castle without its own lord, directly controlled by the main castle (Osaka Castle and Nijo Castle in the Edo period are among such castles of the shogunate government.)

Banjiro or bantejiro (both mean guard castles): A branch castle without its own lord, directly controlled by the main castle (Osaka-jo Castle and Nijo-jo Castle in the Edo period are among such castles of the shogunate government).
sen.cmt: コロンを使用しました。

sen.j: 繋の城・伝えの城 狼煙による通信連絡を行ったり、街道の関所、兵員の集結、移動、宿営のための駐屯基地などの役割を担う城。
sen.e: Linking castle or communciations castle, a castle playing the role of garrison, for contact and communication via smoke signals or for opening up roads and gathering, transferring or accomodating soldiers.

Linking castle or communciations castle, a castle playing the role of garrison, for contact and communication via smoke signals or for opening up roads and gathering, transferring or accomodating soldiers.

Linking castle or communications castle: A castle playing the role of garrison, for contact and communication via smoke signals, for checking travelers crossing the border, and for gathering, transferring or accommodating soldiers.

sen.j: 陣城 野戦時などに臨時構築される簡易の城
sen.e: battle castle, simple castle built as a temporary structure during field battles.
battle castle, simple castle built as a temporary structure during field battles.

sen.cmt: コロンを使用しました。

sen.j: 支城網（しじょうもう）とは日本の主に戦国時代 (日本)に発達した、各地域の拠点や本拠となる本城と、それを守るように周囲に補助的役割の支城・枝城・端城などと呼ばれる城・砦・陣屋群を張り巡らせた防衛及び統治ネットワークを指す。
sen.e: Branch castle network refers to a defense or governing network of castles, forts and fortifications called branch castles (shijo, edajira, hajiro) performing a support function and scattered around a main castle which is the stronghold or base in each region developed mainly in the Warring States period (Japan).

Branch castle network refers to a defense or governing network of castles, forts and fortifications called branch castles (shijo, edajira, hajiro) performing a support function and scattered around a main castle which is the stronghold or base in each region developed mainly in the Warring States period (Japan).

Shijo-mo (branch castle network) refers to a defense or governing network of castles, forts and fortifications called branch castles (shijo, edajiro, hajiro) performing a support function and scattered around a main castle which is the stronghold or base in each region developed mainly in the Sengoku Period (Japan).

sen.j: 規模は様々で、例えば箕輪城は大小三百二もの支城・砦で構築された支城網を誇っていた。
sen.e: The scale varied and for example Minowa Castle boasted a branch castle network consisting of three hundred and two branch castles and forts large and small.
The scale varied and for example Minowa Castle boasted a branch castle network consisting of three hundred and two branch castles and forts large and small.
The scale varied and for example Minowa-jo Castle boasted a shijo-mo consisting of three hundred and two shijo and forts large and small.
